2: the id of the guild (may be missing for some channel objects received over gateway guild dispatches)
4: explicit permission overwrites for members and roles
5: the name of the channel (1-100 characters)
6: the channel topic (0-4096 characters for GUILD_FORUM and GUILD_MEDIA channels, 0-1024 characters for all others)
8: the id of the last message sent in this channel (or thread for GUILD_FORUM or GUILD_MEDIA channels) (may not point to an existing or valid message or thread)
9: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel
10: the user limit of the voice channel
11: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected
13: icon hash of the group DM
14: id of the creator of the group DM or thread
15: application id of the group DM creator if it is bot-created
16: for group DM channels: whether the channel is managed by an application via the gdm.join OAuth2 scope
17: for guild channels: id of the parent category for a channel (each parent category can contain up to 50 channels), for threads: id of the text channel this thread was created
18: when the last pinned message was pinned. This may be null in events such as GUILD_CREATE when a message is not pinned.
19: voice region id for the voice channel, automatic when set to null
20: the camera video quality mode of the voice channel, 1 when not present
21: number of messages (not including the initial message or deleted messages) in a thread.
22: an approximate count of users in a thread, stops counting at 50
23: thread-specific fields not needed by other channels
24: thread member object for the current user, if they have joined the thread, only included on certain API endpoints
25: default duration, copied onto newly created threads, in minutes, threads will stop showing in the channel list after the specified period of inactivity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080
26: computed permissions for the invoking user in the channel, including overwrites, only included when part of the resolved data received on a slash command interaction. This does not include implicit permissions, which may need to be checked separately
27: channel flags combined as a bitfield
28: number of messages ever sent in a thread, it's similar to message_count on message creation, but will not decrement the number when a message is deleted
29: the set of tags that can be used in a GUILD_FORUM or a GUILD_MEDIA channel
30: the IDs of the set of tags that have been applied to a thread in a GUILD_FORUM or a GUILD_MEDIA channel
31: the emoji to show in the add reaction button on a thread in a GUILD_FORUM or a GUILD_MEDIA channel
32: the initial rate_limit_per_user to set on newly created threads in a channel. this field is copied to the thread at creation time and does not live update.
33: the default sort order type used to order posts in GUILD_FORUM and GUILD_MEDIA channels. Defaults to null, which indicates a preferred sort order hasn't been set by a channel admin
34: the default forum layout view used to display posts in GUILD_FORUM channels. Defaults to 0, which indicates a layout view has not been set by a channel admin

0: a text channel within a server
2: a voice channel within a server
3: a direct message between multiple users
4: an organizational category that contains up to 50 channels
5: a channel that users can follow and crosspost into their own server (formerly news channels)
6: a temporary sub-channel within a GUILD_ANNOUNCEMENT channel
7: a temporary sub-channel within a GUILD_TEXT or GUILD_FORUM channel
8: a temporary sub-channel within a GUILD_TEXT channel that is only viewable by those invited and those with the MANAGE_THREADS permission
9: a voice channel for hosting events with an audience
10: the channel in a hub containing the listed servers
11: Channel that can only contain threads
12: Channel that can only contain threads, similar to GUILD_FORUM channels

0: Discord chooses the quality for optimal performance
this thread is pinned to the top of its parent GUILD_FORUM or GUILD_MEDIA channel
1: whether a tag is required to be specified when creating a thread in a GUILD_FORUM or a GUILD_MEDIA channel. Tags are specified in the applied_tags field.
2: when set hides the embedded media download options. Available only for media channels

1: Sort forum posts by creation time (from most recent to oldest)

0: No default has been set for forum channel
2: Display posts as a collection of tiles

1: id of the channel the message was sent in
2: the author of this message (not guaranteed to be a valid user, see below)
5: when this message was edited (or null if never)
6: whether this was a TTS message
8: users specifically mentioned in the message
9: roles specifically mentioned in this message
10: channels specifically mentioned in this message
14: used for validating a message was sent
16: if the message is generated by a webhook, this is the webhook's id
18: sent with Rich Presence-related chat embeds
19: sent with Rich Presence-related chat embeds
20: if the message is an Interaction or application-owned webhook, this is the id of the application
21: data showing the source of a crosspost, channel follow add, pin, or reply message
22: message flags combined as a bitfield
23: the message associated with the message_reference
24: sent if the message is a response to an Interaction
25: the thread that was started from this message, includes thread member object
26: sent if the message contains components like buttons, action rows, or other interactive components
27: array of message sticker item objects
sent if the message contains stickers
28: Deprecated the stickers sent with the message
29: A generally increasing integer (there may be gaps or duplicates) that represents the approximate position of the message in a thread, it can be used to estimate the relative position of the message in a thread in company with total_message_sent on parent thread
30: data of the role subscription purchase or renewal that prompted this ROLE_SUBSCRIPTION_PURCHASE message

1: party_id from a Rich Presence event

0: this message has been published to subscribed channels (via Channel Following)
1: this message originated from a message in another channel (via Channel Following)
2: do not include any embeds when serializing this message
3: the source message for this crosspost has been deleted (via Channel Following)
4: this message came from the urgent message system
5: this message has an associated thread, with the same id as the message
6: this message is only visible to the user who invoked the Interaction
7: this message is an Interaction Response and the bot is "thinking"
8: this message failed to mention some roles and add their members to the thread
9: this message will not trigger push and desktop notifications
10: this message is a voice message

1: id of the originating message's channel
2: id of the originating message's guild
3: when sending, whether to error if the referenced message doesn't exist instead of sending as a normal (non-reply) message, default true

0: Total number of times this emoji has been used to react (including super reacts)
2: Whether the current user reacted using this emoji
3: Whether the current user super-reacted using this emoji
5: HEX colors used for super reaction

1: the thread will stop showing in the channel list after auto_archive_duration minutes of inactivity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080
2: timestamp when the thread's archive status was last changed, used for calculating recent activity
3: whether the thread is locked; when a thread is locked, only users with MANAGE_THREADS can unarchive it
4: whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to a thread; only available on private threads
5: timestamp when the thread was created; only populated for threads created after 2022-01-09

2: Time the user last joined the thread
3: Any user-thread settings, currently only used for notifications

0: the id of a guild's custom emoji
1: the unicode character of the emoji
the name of the tag (0-20 characters)
2: whether this tag can only be added to or removed from threads by a member with the MANAGE_THREADS permission
3: the id of a guild's custom emoji *
4: the unicode character of the emoji *

1: type of embed (always "rich" for webhook embeds)

0: generic embed rendered from embed attributes
3: animated gif image embed rendered as a video embed

0: source url of thumbnail (only supports http(s) and attachments)
1: a proxied url of the thumbnail
a proxied url of the video

0: source url of image (only supports http(s) and attachments)
1: a proxied url of the image

2: url of author icon (only supports http(s) and attachments)
3: a proxied url of author icon

1: url of footer icon (only supports http(s) and attachments)
2: a proxied url of footer icon
whether or not this field should display inline

10: the duration of the audio file (currently for voice messages)
11: base64 encoded bytearray representing a sampled waveform (currently for voice messages)
12: attachment flags combined as a bitfield

0: this attachment has been edited using the remix feature on mobile

1: id of the guild containing the channel

0: An array of allowed mention types to parse from the content.
1: Array of role_ids to mention (Max size of 100)
2: Array of user_ids to mention (Max size of 100)
3: For replies, whether to mention the author of the message being replied to (default false)

0: the id of the sku and listing that the user is subscribed to
1: the name of the tier that the user is subscribed to
2: the cumulative number of months that the user has been subscribed for
3: whether this notification is for a renewal rather than a new purchase

1: the type of channel; only conversion between text and announcement is supported and only in guilds with the "NEWS" feature
2: the position of the channel in the left-hand listing
3: 0-1024 character channel topic (0-4096 characters for GUILD_FORUM and GUILD_MEDIA channels)
4: Text, Voice, Announcement, Stage, Forum, Media
5: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected
6: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice or stage channel; min 8000
7: the user limit of the voice or stage channel, max 99 for voice channels and 10,000 for stage channels (0 refers to no limit)
9: id of the new parent category for a channel
Text, Voice, Announcement, Stage, Forum, Media
10: channel voice region id, automatic when set to null
11: the camera video quality mode of the voice channel
12: the default duration that the clients use (not the API) for newly created threads in the channel, in minutes, to automatically archive the thread after recent activity
13: channel flags combined as a bitfield. Currently only REQUIRE_TAG (1 << 4) is supported by GUILD_FORUM and GUILD_MEDIA channels. HIDE_MEDIA_DOWNLOAD_OPTIONS (1 << 15) is supported only by GUILD_MEDIA channels
14: the set of tags that can be used in a GUILD_FORUM or a GUILD_MEDIA channel; limited to 20
15: the emoji to show in the add reaction button on a thread in a GUILD_FORUM or a GUILD_MEDIA channel
16: the initial rate_limit_per_user to set on newly created threads in a channel. this field is copied to the thread at creation time and does not live update.
17: the default sort order type used to order posts in GUILD_FORUM and GUILD_MEDIA channels
18: the default forum layout type used to display posts in GUILD_FORUM channels

2: the thread will stop showing in the channel list after auto_archive_duration minutes of inactivity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080
3: whether the thread is locked; when a thread is locked, only users with MANAGE_THREADS can unarchive it
4: whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to a thread; only available on private threads
5: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages, manage_thread, or manage_channel, are unaffected
6: channel flags combined as a bitfield; PINNED can only be set for threads in forum and media channels
7: the IDs of the set of tags that have been applied to a thread in a GUILD_FORUM or a GUILD_MEDIA channel; limited to 5

0: Get messages around this message ID
1: Get messages before this message ID
2: Get messages after this message ID
3: Max number of messages to return (1-100)

1: Can be used to verify a message was sent (up to 25 characters). Value will appear in the Message Create event.
2: true if this is a TTS message
3: Up to 10 rich embeds (up to 6000 characters)
5: Include to make your message a reply
6: Components to include with the message
7: IDs of up to 3 stickers in the server to send in the message
8: Contents of the file being sent. See Uploading Files
9: JSON-encoded body of non-file params, only for multipart/form-data requests. See Uploading Files
10: Attachment objects with filename and description. See Uploading Files
11: Message flags combined as a bitfield (only SUPPRESS_EMBEDS and SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATIONS can be set)

0: Get users after this user ID
1: Max number of users to return (1-100)
Up to 10 rich embeds (up to 6000 characters)
2: Edit the flags of a message (only SUPPRESS_EMBEDS can currently be set/unset)
4: Components to include with the message
5: Contents of the file being sent/edited. See Uploading Files
6: JSON-encoded body of non-file params (multipart/form-data only). See Uploading Files
7: Attached files to keep and possible descriptions for new files. See Uploading Files

0: an array of message ids to delete (2-100)
the bitwise value of all allowed permissions (default "0")
1: the bitwise value of all disallowed permissions (default "0")
2: 0 for a role or 1 for a member

0: duration of invite in seconds before expiry, or 0 for never. between 0 and 604800 (7 days)
1: max number of uses or 0 for unlimited. between 0 and 100
2: whether this invite only grants temporary membership
3: if true, don't try to reuse a similar invite (useful for creating many unique one time use invites)
4: the type of target for this voice channel invite
5: the id of the user whose stream to display for this invite, required if target_type is 1, the user must be streaming in the channel
6: the id of the embedded application to open for this invite, required if target_type is 2, the application must have the EMBEDDED flag

0: access token of a user that has granted your app the gdm.join scope
1: nickname of the user being added
